title: American_Top_40_1980_November_1st
description:
American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast:

The Pointer Sisters are in the countdown with, "He's So Shy," and the Rolling Stones are too with, "She's So Cold."

John Lennon and Neil Diamond debut on the hot 100 all the way up in the top 40!

But Diana Ross has two hits in the top 10 at the same time!

One listener wants to know, "What act has had the most number one albums in a row?" The answer is an act whose eight number-one album streak was cut short due to their own popularity.

A Canadian listener wants to know, "What Canadian recording act has been the most successful on the American charts?"

Casey answers the question, "Who had the biggest selling record of the 50's, the 60's, and the 70's?"

This is one of several broadcasts where Casey pays tribute to the world's first disc jockey, Al Jarvis.

One singer in the countdown has had twice as mant hits in England as the Beatles.
